website_summaries.verdict: Design aimed at helping cats eat slowly. Feeder works with varying sizes of food, including semi-moist foods.
pros: Can program for up to 12 meal times per day at sizes between 1/8 cup and 4 cups
Runs on battery or AC adapter
Customers like the stainless steel bowl, as it's easier to clean than a plastic bowl
cons: Some owners report problems with programming the feeder
Feeder doesn't always deliver exact food measurements

customer_reviews.title: Great for two cats.
customer_reviews.text: Great for two cats. I use it with a 14x18 fast food tray tray for better sharing. (I removed the bowl and it's holder). As requested by J, here is picture of mine in use.
customer_reviews.author: KarenCNP

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome, BUT
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome, BUT...difficult to program at first and change once programmed. I only put a little bit of food in at first to see how it worked, and then the conveyor belt was acting weird when I did fill the hopper. It's okay, my cat (shown in the photo) figured out how to tip it over and get the food out in the middle of the night anyway. So much for trying to cut down on her portions...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: At first this worked like a charm. We've been using it since July 2016. After 4 months the wire from the batteries to the gears burned through do we had to purchase an AC adapter. That worked for about 3 days and now the wiring from AC adapter to the gears has burned and the gear mechanism is now frozen and won't move. I'd like to get in touch with the vendor to see about a replacement because $130.00 is a lot yo pay for something that only lasts for 4 months 😠 but there is no contact seller on this site.
customer_reviews.author: Hart's LP

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my custom adapter to feed two cats!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! My cats throw up if they eat too much too fast, so this is great being able to feed them 1/8 cup per feeding, multiple times per day. I also made (and am selling) an adapter that will distribute the food into two different bowls. This is a great and inexpensive alternative to buying a second feeder for $130. Link to Two-Way splitter adapter: Three-way Splitter adapter: See the link above, or search for "Splitter Adapter for PetSafe Healthy Pet Simply Feed Automatic Feeder" on Amazon or Ebay. You can also seach the same thing on YouTube and view a video of it :)
customer_reviews.author: Beachbum

customer_reviews.title: Not Cat-Proof
customer_reviews.text: Unintuitive to program. Not secure enough for persistent cats. The lid latch is flimsy, so I had to put a book on top of the feeder. My cats have figured out how to get food from it by just sticking their paw inside the dispensing chute, and its not just remnants from the last meal. It dispenses fine, but its not cat-proof.
customer_reviews.author: kiki honez

customer_reviews.title: Planned Obsolescence or Absurd Coincidence?
customer_reviews.text: Immediately after the warranty ran the unit broke. It threw an error code, so I followed the instructions and replaced the batteries. Same error persisted. So I moved down the list of possibilities and found that the mechanism that connects the motor to the conveyor belt is held together by the world's cheapest piece of plastic. It no longer hooks the belt drive in place. So I'm left with a $100+ plastic piece of crap two days after the warranty ran. Almost unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: JBG

customer_reviews.title: Princess - Cure for overeating, FAT cat
customer_reviews.text: I wish my veterinarian would have suggested that I buy an automatic cat feeder to control Princess' unending appetite. Because Princess was orphaned as a kitten, she has not forgotten her hunger pains. I am a senior citizen. I found programming the computerized, automatic cat feeder challenging. The printed instructions need to be revised for senior citizens. I could not have completed the programming if I had not watched the video instructions MANY times. Now, the cat feeder dispenses 1/4 cup of dry cat food at 8:00 a.m. daily; and 1/8 cup of dry cat food at 5:00 p.m., as recommended by Princess' vet. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Cat Lady

customer_reviews.title: Buy this, buy this, buy this! Highest recommendation!
customer_reviews.text: This is brilliant! We've had ours since 2017 (three years). We used to use it just for when we left the cat for a few days (try that with a dog--good luck) but then thought, why don't we use it all the time. No longer do we get wakened by a yowling cat-- she knows exactly when the food will come. The bin is large enough that we don't have to fill it often--we do check though if we're leaving the house for more than a day. Customer service? The couple of times I had trouble with the programming a rep talked me through it each time, pleasantly and competently. We should have gotten this years before. Highest recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Just a guy from France in the corner

customer_reviews.title: Good reliable product and batteries, for me, lasted over 3 years.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item in May of 2017. I have 3 indoor cats and have used this feeder indoors every day since it arrived in the mail. I have varied the feeding schedule multiple times. I currently have the feeder set to do 5 small feedings throughout the day with one feeding in the middle of the night to eliminate the early morning "feed me" wakeup calls. One concern I had was regarding battery life. I placed 4 Duracell copper top batteries in this device when the feeder arrived. I had to replace the batteries today. Three years and one month later. I hope this review will help others with their decision.
customer_reviews.author: P. Toivonen

customer_reviews.title: Very Fragile
customer_reviews.text: Dog knocked this over and tried to get into this 1 time, the the LED screen stopped working, within the first 20 days. Junk. For reference, the last auto-feeder made from chinesium survived at least a dozen break-in attempts over the course of 3 years. So many, that I had to modify the feeder hopper with a planter from lowes and a cable lock contraption. I call that pretty heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Great for sanity!
customer_reviews.text: If you have to put your fatty on a diet and can’t be with in the minute for twice a day feedings, which leads to him insisting that the world is falling apart around his ears “RIGHT MEOW”, then this feeder is for you. The adjustable serving sizes are fantastic so you can gradually reduce tubbys serving size to a healthier porportion over time with out him noticing. The battery backup is also great incase the power goes out right before feeding time so he doesn’t starve to death.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great for multi cats!
customer_reviews.text: Needed something so my 3 cats would stop hassling me at 5 am. This was the only feeder with decent reviews, could be programmed for multiple meals, prevent my cats from opening it, and do small enough portions. Took a couple trials for the plate to use underneath, but instead of buying 3 individual feeders I put a dog food mat from pet smart underneath. All the cats are somewhat aggressive except one but they seemed to have figured it out so they all can eat.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Originally my wife and I were very happy with this feeder. We bought two of them for our dogs and they worked great...for a while. One of the buttons broke on one of the feeders after about 6 months, inconvenient, but not a deal breaker. A month or two later, the clock continued to reset and just blink "12", wonder how many meals were missed. I broke down and ordered a third feeder since I still had one that worked perfectly. Third feeder arrived, programmed it, worked once, then quit working and started blinking "12" again. Re-read the directions, followed to the "t", still won't hold a program or dispense food...returning it and going back to manual feelings again.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy in CV

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY!  Updated
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: After a little more than a year, the feeder stopped working completely. This is an overpriced, complicated, piece of garbage. I found this feeder ridiculously complicated to program as noted by other reviewers. I would have put up with that if the PetSafe Feeder had continued to work. It worked correctly for about a month and then just quit. I checked the batteries; I pulled the batteries; I cleaned all the removable parts and NOTHING. I called customer support and that was pointless—I was just told to do what I'd done. So I have a big clunky piece of sculpture that sits on my kitchen floor and is totally useless. $130 dollars down the drain. DON'T DO IT!
customer_reviews.author: LizR

customer_reviews.title: Long battery life with little maintenance
customer_reviews.text: If you're wondering about battery life I ordered this on May 11, 2016 and today, September 27, 2019, Yes, 2019, the original batteries have finally quit working. It has worked perfectly since installation with only once having to clean out the food assembly area. Well worth the purchase especially to allow the flexibility to be away from home and not worry about your pet being fed properly and on time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Necessary for the PetSafe Automatic Feeder
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly, the PetSafe Automatic Feeder didn't come with this cord. Since we use the feeder every day, batteries are not practical. I would hate for my pet to miss his meals due to no batteries. The feeder should come with this cord to begin with, as it is necessary for daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda

customer_reviews.title: This one is built with a superior design using a conveyor belt to dispense which is ...
customer_reviews.text: I have owned 5 of the MOTO feeders. All are now non-functional. This one is built with a superior design using a conveyor belt to dispense which is removable to service, replace or clean. I am using this on the porch of my cabin in the woods to dispense a morning only feeding to my country cat without also feeding the RACCOONS. I have succeeded by using a beer cooler to house the feeder. Photos attached.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Yates

customer_reviews.title: i am impressed
customer_reviews.text: i never thought i would EVER buy something like this. Our cat will throw up if food is left out she just gorges herself, my husband and I both work so are not able to feed her on a regular schedule. so i broke down and bought this feeder. I am glad i did, ..If a person follows the directions and sets it up for there pet it works well. Our cat gets fed every 3 hours, even at night and she is ever so happy to be able to eat even when we are not home. She has thrown up only once since, it was at the beginning when i was not sure of the amount to give her...
customer_reviews.author: valeria crow

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This separating device works for the most part perfectly and as described. It connects into the feeder seemlessly and dispenses food equally between the dishes. Where the problem is the original single feed had a device/ring that held the bowl in place under the dispenser, there is no such device/ring to hold the divided bowls in place. My cat(s) plays with the food and bowls and the next thing I know the food is being dispensed on the floor because the bowl is across the room. This did not happen before when the bowl was secure under the dispenser.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Excellent feeder for our cats
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is so great. It’s easy to program, and the directions are super clear. I have had this for 6 months and it is holding up great. If you have multiple cats, I would highly recommend getting the 3D printed attachment that splits the food into two portions as it comes out. It’s also the only feeder I have found that my cats can’t break into! Another nice feature is that it has batteries and a plug in. That way your feeding times don’t get forgotten if you have to unplug it. And we’re not constantly buying batteries since we run off the electrical most of the time! 10/10 would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Great for Travelers
customer_reviews.text: This is great!!! We are retired and travel but have an outside cat that stays home. In the past we had to ask the neighbors to feed our cat 2 times each day. They were very helpful but we felt guilty have to ask for help all the time. This units works as stated and is reliable to feed our cat. We have the feeder next to our NEST doorbell which allows us to monitor the feeding cycles and call the neighbor for help, if necessary. There have been no failures from the feeder. Consistently feeds as programed. We now have the freedom to travel. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Field

customer_reviews.title: LIFE SAVER FOR THOSE WITH CATS THAT WAKE YOU UP IN THE NIGHT
customer_reviews.text: This product helped me get more sleep which is invaluable. For the past 4 years, my cat has woken me up wanting food at 4am. Whyyyy? I've NEVER given him food at 4am?! Anywho, I set this baby to dispense a snack right before 4am and guess what?! My cat doesn't wake me up anymore!!!! A partial con is that is it battery operated so I have to monitor that closely. However, this device isn't a battery "eater." The batteries we have in it now have lasted for 3 months. We have 2 cats so we bought an attachment to dispense into 2 bowls. Overall, I love this thing and I wish I had found it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Hilary

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: So far works great! My last feeder broke after a year and it was about the same price as this ine. So hoping this will last longer. It did take my cat a while to get used to how load it is when the food hits the bowl and he doesn't love sticking his head under the spout. I'm thinking about buying a shallower bowl so his head won't be so close to the spout.
customer_reviews.author: rosesvengeance

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Feeder for Multi Cat Use (Plus the Splitter)
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is amazing. We tried to use other timed feeders for our two cats, but the timing would always start off great, and after a few days be minutes a part. We bought this feeder, along with splitter from beachbum25119 on ebay, and it feeds both of our cats at the same exact time, super easy! See the video to watch how precise and amazing it is. I would highly recommend this product AND the add on for those who need to feed multiple cats. Don't buy multiple feeders...just get the add on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat lets me sleep!!!
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is wonderful. It is much quieter than other brands. The feeding mechanism is paw proof. My cat cannot make it a free feeder as she has for other brands!! I read the reviews about it being difficult to program, it is pretty user friendly if you READ and FOLLOW the directions! This feeder has a wonderful slow feeding mode. It spaces out the food over a 15 minute period. This prevents my cat from eating so quick that she makes herslef sick. I have purchased many feeders over the life of my cat and this one is supreme!!
customer_reviews.author: TiffB80

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good feeder
customer_reviews.text: The feeder overall is dependable and appears to be well made. There are a lot of great features on this unit such as portion control , multiple feeding times, and a "pet-proof" lid. I would have given 5 stars on this product if the manual was better written and organized. The programming of the feeder can be a nightmare. All the necessary info is in the manual but it is disjointed and in an illogical format. The LCD screen is very dim and hard to read. Adding back-lighting to the display would help immensely. The AC adapter should be included in the main package instead of being sent separately.
customer_reviews.author: danno101

customer_reviews.title: Not a keeper
customer_reviews.text: After using this automatic feeder for ten months, I have discontinued use. It performed reliably, and battery usage is reasonable. However, the food in the reservoir is not stored in such a way as to stay fresh. As the food grows stale it attracts bugs (read: cockroaches), even in a setting where bugs are rare. The reservoir itself can be cleaned out with some disassembly, however its is difficult to keep clean when in daily use (which is why you need an auto feeder). Cleaning the conveyor is really difficult, though, and that seems to be the source of rancid odor and decaying food particles.
customer_reviews.author: Blissboat

customer_reviews.title: I like it so far
customer_reviews.text: My Petnet auto feeder doesn’t work anymore due to the company went out of business. So I decided to buy an auto feeder which doesn’t need internet access to change feeding schedules. I shopped around and compare by reading the reviews. I choose this product at the end. I saw some people complain about the food portion, but so far this feeder give my cat the correct portion every time, has not stuck for once. The only downside of it is that it doesn’t let me manually feed extra meal. If I do that, it would mess up the other meals.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry A

customer_reviews.title: I love it, but I hate it
customer_reviews.text: I love it, but I hate it. It really is nice in terms of automatically feeding my cats. What I hate about it: --The chamber for food is too small. --The lid for the food chamber is too opaque to see how much food is left without taking the lid off. --Setting up the feeding schedule is not super quick/easy. --The power cord is sold separately. --The metal bowl is LOUD when hard food hits it. Seriously.. it would not be difficult for a company to make a few small tweaks to this, make it wifi enabled, develop an app, and make a killing selling them.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Technically it does split the food. The split does seem to be pretty even, but the design could definitely be improved. Unless I got a piece that's slightly defective, it doesn't seem to sit flush with where the food comes out of the machine. I've tried adjusting the position several times, but there always seems to be pieces of the food on the floor and under the splitter. Honestly, there's a good chance I'll be returning and trying one of the third party ones to see if that works any better.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny D.

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable! Don’t trust it!
customer_reviews.text: All the meals for my cat are programmed with the “slow feed indicator” (Food is dispensed over 15 minutes) and one day I started noticing there was never any food in his bowl... if he’s fed enough, he always leaves a little. I watched out for when the food would drop. When it came down, it only spit out about 25 or so little food bits, so I watched and waited for the “15 minute feed window” for the rest of his portion...NOTHING MORE CAME OUT! My poor baby had only been fed a fraction of what he’s supposed to eat! I’m livid!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie A.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works great. My only complaint is that if you unplug it, even for a second or the power fluctuates, you lose all programming and have to input it again. Which is not fast. There is battery operation but it's a lot of batteries and I don't want to use battery power. A small disc battery back up for memory only would be a nice addition. Otherwise works great. Seems sturdy enough. Keeps my cat happy and from over eating and puking everywhere. Helps us feed him when we go out of town.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flaws but not deal breakers.
customer_reviews.text: My biggest complaint is that your programs are lost if the feeder looses power. If you want any amount of reliability, both the AC power supply and 4 D cell batteries are required. Smaller complaints: -Type C power would be nice -A backup NiMH, LiO or LiPo battery backups integrated into the unit would make a large improvement to the dependability of the unit -Programming is quite clunky and difficult. Expect to read the manual
customer_reviews.author: Ethan J. Block

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent food feeder.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent autofeeder. It frees my time to feed my baby by myself. Initially, I chose the default cat feeding option, which will deliver two portions of 1/4 cup each at 8am and 5pm. My little senior cat just complained the little food given. I tried not to interfere and gave it a try for two days. Now my baby just get used to it and will not eat them all at once. One thing I don't like is that I have to re-calibrate the machine each time I add more food in the container. Also, to me it's not that intuitive to operate. Now I just need to find another water feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: Working well...Jury is still out...
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Upping this to a four. Son figured out how to program it and it’s working really well...so far. I can’t really even rate this product because I can’t decipher the instructions on how to set it. I may not be the brightest bulb on the Christmas Tree but I do ok in the world of technology. But these directions are ridiculous. I will definitely come back and alter the rating if I ever get it to work. I hope I don’t have to return it. I was kind of excited by the concept of it.
customer_reviews.author: Josie James

customer_reviews.title: Glad I read other reviews which recommended this power adapter ...
customer_reviews.text: Glad I read other reviews which recommended this power adapter for my automatic pet feeder. The feeder has a place for a power cord but didn't come with one. I use batteries as a back-up power source but the adapter for the main power. It fit perfectly with my appliance and works as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Hip Sistah

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: It is so fabulous not being woken up by two hungry cats. It took me a little while to get the programming right, but once you get it setup it works like a charm. It was easy to change the feeding portions as well. It holds quite a bit of cat food so I only have to refill it every couple weeks. I wish I had of purchased this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly a FAST setup
customer_reviews.text: Voluminous instructions, more of a science project than a quick start feeding station. Instructions not exactly perfect either, for instance you have to prepare the conveyor belt to ensure food is properly distributed. The booklet does not tell you to hold the buttons until food is dispensed, rather it says to hold the buttons until you hear movement. PROS: big hopper, battery and A/C powered, user customizable feeding programs. CONS: Lengthy setup, too many instructions in text paragraph form, lightweight (will probably have to figure out a way to eliminate tip over.
customer_reviews.author: Pipercub

customer_reviews.title: Best feeder we have owned
customer_reviews.text: Confused the cats for a week as I had it set to smallest portion every two hours from 0400 - 2200 instead of the usual three times a day. Now its not so much of a dash through the house when the food drops, (except for the 0400 feeding) Simple to clean and really love the locking lid. Cats are not "beating" this one up trying to get a couple of extra pieces. Love the plug in to the wall feature NO MORE BATTERIES to change.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome feeder with lots of versatility
customer_reviews.text: The great feeder with lots of versatility. I have it set to feed my cats one eighth of a cup 4 times a day. I have measured and it is very precise for all the foods that I have tried with it. I put batteries in it for backup power and I also bought the "ZOZOTMUniversal 12W 3V-12V Regulated Multi Voltage Switching Replacement Power Adapter" so I could plug it in rather than just use batteries and so far it has worked without fail through power outages and while I'm away traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Nate H

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t dispense completely
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this machine to use for a barn cat so I wouldn’t have to go feed her by hand every day. Plan was to build a wood box around this feeder so raccoons could get to her food. But because it doesn’t dispense completely I believe raccoons will reach up into it and destroy the flaps on the paddle wheel device thinking they can get more food to drop. (Food stays balanced on the last paddle and falls when you touch it with your fingers.) this food staying on the paddle wheel also causes a food smell in the air. Another thing to draw in raccoons.
customer_reviews.author: Amyeliz

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Our annoying food-crazed cat no longer wakes us up at 4am to be fed. He no longer follows us around whining from the second we get home from work until the second we feed him. It's great to leave for the weekend and not have to make arrangements to take him somewhere or have someone come feed him every day. We've had it for about a month now. Not the easiest thing to set up, but the directions are adequate. Haven't touched it since we set it up, and it's been working flawlessly. It took our cat about a week to really stop begging for food and to go wait by the machine instead. Absolutely worth the money to us.
customer_reviews.author: behlski

customer_reviews.title: reliable and convenient
customer_reviews.text: We use the feeder in a sheltered outdoor cabinet with a hole cut in the front that allows feeding and control display. The cabinet is locked to defeat racoons, possums, and other critters. The feeder has been in service 4 months and has fed our outdoor feline reliably. The controls on the front are extemely convenient. We've used other feeders over the last 5 years with limited success. We've purchased another PetSafe Healthy Pet Simply Feed Automatic Cat and Dog Feeder for indoor use.
customer_reviews.author: Penelope Gaines

customer_reviews.title: Cats can’t bump to get extra food.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that could be better is the ease of use. The instructions are clear, but every time I refill the bowl, I have to find the instructions to remind myself how to load food on the belt. (I know, if the bowl didn’t run out of food I wouldn’t have to mess with that). The interface isn’t obvious on how to run the machine. However, once you have it all set up, it works great! And the best thing is, my ridiculous cats can’t bump the bowl to get extra food. They were getting really fat with their last bowl, but not this one!
customer_reviews.author: GMoney

customer_reviews.title: Happy cats
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is working really well for my clients. I took a cathouse and insulated it, added some bricks so raccoons wouldn’t carry it off and put it on a porch for ferals I had to call the company to set up the feeding schedule. They were lovely. Works well. Cats are happy. Would definitely recommend and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: vvk

customer_reviews.title: A great convenience for pet lovers
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why it took me so long to buy this! The feeder holds a large amount of food so depending on the feeder settings, you may refill it once a week at most. The motor is quiet but my blind dog comes right over when he hears his kibble shoot into the bowl. No more waiting for me to wake up, come home, or break an activity to scoop his meal. It was a little difficult to setup initially but after a couple of tries, it worked perfectly. I recommend purchasing the power cord. I imagine you'll replace your batteries before you refill the feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Ebug

customer_reviews.title: Should have come with the feeder
customer_reviews.text: I strongly feel like this should come with the feeder. It's great and works just fine but it's an obvious grab for a little extra money from the customer in my opinion. I really just can't imagine there are that many people who use it on a regular basis in a place with no wired power source. It's a necessity for efficient use. If one came for free and you had to buy another if it failed or you lost it, that'd be fine, but it's dumb you have to buy this separately even at the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Michele

customer_reviews.title: Great basic dog/cat feeder - gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Extremely versatile. Purchased two of these to feed our two dogs while on vacation; worked so well we use them all the time now. Seems to meter the food correctly and the feed timing is spot on. The controls are a little complicated if you don't read the instructions, but nothing a 12+ year old can't figure out. Functionally these are superior. No bells and whistles like WiFi connectivity or mobile apps.. just feeds your dog or cat regularly. Note they use 4 D cell batteries, and do not come with a charger. Says the batteries last nearly a year, and after several months they are still running great on the first set of batteries.
customer_reviews.author: denver

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic, and never worked properly.
customer_reviews.text: After following all instructions, the feeder conveyor belt simply wouldn't work. I'm guessing something was wired wrong -- it wanted to turn, but didn't have enough power. In general this seemed like it was very cheap construction and had a lot of parts which would easily fail or come open (the hopper in particular seemed very easy to tip over.) The box itself was very beat up and taped over, and this is not a feeder that seems sturdy enough to take that sort of abuse. Returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Good, but complicated
customer_reviews.text: Once installed, it works fine for a cat who gets fed in 1/8 cup portions. That said, it is very complicated to set up and/or change schedules and times and replace batteries. One hint: no matter what the error code is, change the batteries. The phone line for the device does not know this. This will happen without warning, and possibly could be averted by changing the batteries every six months or so. Of course, changing batteries...
customer_reviews.author: Mary S

customer_reviews.title: Did not like that I had to purchase this power adapter separate ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not like that I had to purchase this power adapter separate from the Pet Simply Feeder. The feeder works great but should include the power adapter.
customer_reviews.author: almyrta

customer_reviews.title: So far, it's much better than my old feeder.
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is very consistent. In my tests, the feeder accurately dispenses 33g of food per 1/8 cup serving. I'd recommend getting the power adapter (which should probably come with the unit). I have the D batteries installed as a backup. The ability to program any number of feedings per day is excellent. Ideally the pets should get smaller meals every few hours instead of 2 larger meals.
customer_reviews.author: JmX

customer_reviews.title: If you have 2 animals, this is needed.
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be happier with this, it does exactly what it's supposed to do. The cats on the other hand, they don't always figure out that they don't need to share the bowl, oh well, most the time they realize they each have their own. I after many many feedings, looking at the portion split many times, I have never been upset that 1 side got more, pretty much does a perfect job slitting the portion.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Campbell

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I love it! Having a timed feeder has really helped my cats behavior because he no longer associates me with his meal times so he isn’t knocking stuff over for my attention anymore! It’s not too loud, but loud enough for my cat to hear anywhere in the house to know that it’s feeding time. I love that the bowl is super easy to clean and doesn’t give my cat acne like his previous plastic feeder. Also very easy to use and I like that it has the pause, slow feed, and dispense food now options.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria

customer_reviews.title: NOT user friendly. Skip the headache.
customer_reviews.text: We've had this thing for about a year and we only use it when we go out of town. The controls are very confusing and a hassle - we have to read the user manual each time we pull this thing out. I'm young and tech savvy and this thing is SO frustrating, especially when you're in a hurry to leave your house. The plastic is cheap and all the things that should snap into place don't fit perfectly and don't ever snap or lock the way they should. This company needs to hire a UI/UX designer pronto!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Works well - Controls, menu, and instructions are awful - Clock is fast
customer_reviews.text: This feeder has been working steadily for more than a year. And the battery backup is a blessing for temp power outages. HOWEVER. The control menu and instructions for setting up and changing settings are awful. The menu is not intuitive. The buttons are rubberized, but easy to push in too hard and get stuck. The clock runs too fast. That wouldn't be a big thing, but the menu makes updating the time a real pain. Included instructions are anemic. This feeder's menu interface needs a real reboot. Otherwise a solid feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Frankshoes

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with product...
customer_reviews.text: First order got lost in the mail, but another one was sent, so that’s all good Very happy with it so far. We used to feed ou cat 1/4 cup twice a day (doctor’s orders) but he scrarfed down all his food immediately and would be starving in between. With this feeder, we were able to program it to feed him 1/8th of a cup every 5 hours, and he is learning how to graze and not stuff his face at every meal. Vet recommended because cats are supposed to eat just a little a few times a day. It was also easy to program. It will make traveling a lot easier too! I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: smb

customer_reviews.title: Works very well just doesn’t seem suitable to feral cats
customer_reviews.text: A good idea in principle but all these cat products do not work for feral cats. Mine will run away the moment the good is dropped and will eat very little from the provided tray. He seems afraid of the feeder. We decided to put it away for the time being and will give it another try later on. I feel we have a hard to press cat so I don’t blame the company for this. All features work as advertised, very easy to setup, clean and program
customer_reviews.author: book worm 834

customer_reviews.title: Food jammed / Cats went hungry
customer_reviews.text: This item does not fit tight / secure in the feeder. I ran a couple of test runs to see how it worked and the food did not dispense smoothly. I was afraid the food may jam and that's exactly what happened. Once the food jammed and backed up in the feeder, the conveyor ran as scheduled and broke the red lock that holds the conveyor secure against the sprocket. I do not recommend this add-on.
customer_reviews.author: tekt

customer_reviews.title: This cable worked for a couple of hours and then died
customer_reviews.text: I plan to appeal to the seller for a replacement or refund, but I just plugged this in to my feeder without batteries, 2 days before we leave town. It worked fine, and the feeder display showed a plug icon after I set it up. This morning, however, the feeder has no display and no power. Batteries make the unit work fine. The feeder has served me well for years, so I had hoped this power cable would be a nice option. But the power supply seems to be a cheaply-made item, as it basically stopped working immediately. Don't waste your money. I will update this review if the issue is resolved satisfactorily.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Amount of food dispensed much smaller than programmed.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this exact feeder about a year and a half ago. It worked great but then randomly started not dispensing the indicated amount of food. Figured its run its course and bought another one. Got the new one and it's been a month and a half and now this one is doing the same thing. Have it set up for our cat. I had heard it go off and it didnt sound like the correct amount, I checked. Sure enough it barely dispensed any food. Watched it the next couple feedings and still is way short on the amount of food. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: I was using this product to schedule feedings for my 2 cats. The box was hard to open for an older person. It was easy to program but down hill after that. The splitter did not fit which was the main reason I bought the feeder. When I took it off to try and purchase a new one, one cat had already figured out how to get extra food. It is in the process of being sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Sophisticated, works wells
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit hard to learn to program, so never loose the instruction booklet... Otherwise, it works wonderfully well, and measures out down to a 1/8 cup amounts.... My cat did knock it over trying to get into it, so I had to put boxes on both sides of it... and not problems.... This will feed my cat for weeks before it needs a refill..
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Are you About to loose it if not already?
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 cats. Wife 2 me 1. The like to scream at 4am for food. 1 hour before I get up EVERY DAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Then when I get home the do the same. Scream till I feed them. This was the last option before getting rid of them. Got it, set the times, and feeding amount. NO MORE SCREAMING!!!!!!!!!! After a few days use they got it. We still feed them the same amount but spread it out over several 15 min increments. The have lost a little weight but are at a healthy weight per my wife who is a vet. The people who made this are saints!!! Been using this for about 5 months. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Deraj

customer_reviews.title: So many design flaws
customer_reviews.text: The concept is good but there are too many design flaws that make this an unreliable feeder. Pros -Measures food accurately -Long battery life Cons -Dispenses bits of food when bumped. If it gets knocked over, all the food falls off the conveyor belt. Terrible design. -Occacionally get an "error message" where the feeder stops working because of a jam. This is a major issue. -My cats can reach into the dispenser and pull out some kibble. -No AC adapter included (Seriously? Even for $130?) I'd recommend looking for another feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Max Mazan

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine after accepting the fact that the Oxgord model I looked around everywhere was definitely gone. I have tried many models of feeders in my entire life and I have to say that I am very satisfied with the way is setup, the materials quality and its programing logic. Now I just have to wait and see how durable it will be. For those who worry about the setup, if you follow the instructions provided you will have to problems. I am giving it 4 stars because durability is an important factor. I will be back in one year to complete my review.
customer_reviews.author: Rhadames Tellez

customer_reviews.title: EXPENSIVE BUT WORTH IT.
customer_reviews.text: I like knowing exactly how much food is being released. You can set it in multiples of 1/8 cup increments. They also have a slow feed setting if your pet gulps down their food. It feeds on a conveyor belt system that you have to load up before food will be released the first time. It is easy to do. They tell you how in the directions. I like the large food opening at the top so you can just dump the food in. I like the metal bowl for its durability but it is loud when the food is released. You get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great automatic feeder
customer_reviews.text: This is a great device that takes a large bag of cat food. I feed my cat roughly 4 times daily, totaling 1 cup of dry food, and this has never missed a beat for 8 months. It has both AC adapter and ability to run off of D-batteries. I keep it plugged in, and have the D batteries installed in case the power goes out. Overall a great product, that's very programmable, and comes highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: electronics critic

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly durable and reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is such a phenomenally sturdy product! It has been going continuously since 2017 feeding my two feral cats from the garage. It has been attacked repeatedly by raccoons...bitten, clawed, unplugged, dragged, toppled...yet it keeps on going. The only thing they managed to break was the plastic bowl holder ring. The battery back up works great and the unit is fairly easy to clean. I HIGHLY recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MSanto

customer_reviews.title: Love the peace of mind and healthy weight it offers our previous food anxious cat
customer_reviews.text: Solved our incessant wake up call, at 4:30am through 6am. And it has also helped our previously overweight cat slim down to a healthy weight. The sound the food makes hitting the stainless steel bowl summons her from all parts of the house. She isn't food anxious. And our 1-4 night overnights away we feel secure that it's working. Takes a little bit of time to figure out programming, but it does give an accurate 1/8 cup as smallest, which we were finding other feeders dispensed far more generously.
customer_reviews.author: Gwendynn

customer_reviews.title: Winner After 3 Other Types
customer_reviews.text: Finally a winner! This was the third purchase before finally getting one that works and works well. We waited several months and ran on battery before purchasing the adapter (another $20). Once you set up the feeder correctly, it has never skipped a meal. Our cat is same weight and does not seem to be overeating. The only negative is the loud sound when the food drops in the bowl, but we used a paper towel and that disappeared. The cat is smart enough not to eat it and no harm even if she does. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TheITGuyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: CODE TO LOAD FOOD FIRST TIME! NO WAITING
customer_reviews.text: Just changed the batteries for the first time after 3 YEARS of indoor use with two cats. I will not repeat the many great reviews, but I do want to add one HELP: You do not have to wait for several "empty" feedings when you fill the unit the first time to wait for the converter to fill. I'm there instructions, they have a quick load feature that begins/fills the machine. To Load when First Filling: Press the left arrow and center button simultaneously. The machine will then "disburse" several empty portions until food arrives in the bowl, them stop automatically. Essential setting. Enjoy the peace of mind if having food-confident cats!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: since I have had bad luck with another brand that failed within 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I hesitate to review this so soon, since I have had bad luck with another brand that failed within 6 months. But the flexibility of feeding schedule and portion size, as well as how quiet this thing is, I have to say I love it so far. It being so quiet means that the mechanical elements are precisely designed and made. I don't believe this thing will wear out anytime soon like the previous brand I bought. If it fails, then I will update my review. Update (5.17.2017): It's still working perfectly. Very happy with this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works but ...
customer_reviews.text: This splitter works ok but sometimes gets food on the ground instead of in the dish. I like the divider in it but it is flimsy. I also own one of the 3rd party 3D printed splitters which works much more efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: J.P

customer_reviews.title: A quiet cat and a quieted dispenser.
customer_reviews.text: No more getting up at 4:30 in the morning to quiet a very insistent cat. Easy to program: Just follow the good instructions if you can't manage without. But if you have this in hearing distance from where you are sleeping, put a nice ceramic bowl into the SS bowl to quiet the clangs of the dry food falling in. Mine came from joewinterpottery.com and fits perfectly. Also looks great and is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: WJV

customer_reviews.title: Awesone
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 dogs. 1 a lab, the other a beagle so I bought 2 because they have their own feeding spots in the house and require different amounts of food. Set it up for the amounts and measured the amount of food dropped - right on the money as compared to a measuring cup. Set for 1.5 cups and that's exactually what came out. The added benefit is my older dogs were not getting around very well at all due to excessive weight - this has allowed me to control their diet much better. They are losing weight and are acting like they are 5 years younger.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy!!! Don’t know how I lived without it!!
customer_reviews.text: I should of bought this sooner!!! Great storage capacity!! I like how versatile and customizable the meal schedule programming is. Plus, the various size portions of every meal. It can adjust to your pet or pets needs. My only complaint is the locking mechanism on top of the food storage container. It’s very flimsy and not very secure. I can lift up both sides of the lid. If you have a determined pet I feel they could access the food storage area.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Way too easy to get extra food to fall out..
customer_reviews.text: It is way too easy to get extra food to fall out. My cat uses three techniques: she pushes on it with her paws (causing it to shake), she jumps on top of it (causing it to shake), or she sticks her paws up into the conveyor belt. All three techniques work really well for her. I had to wall of the dispenser with heavy books. I also had to put heavy books on top of it, so that she couldn't shake it so easily. Finally, I had to tape cardboard around the conveyor belt opening so she couldn't stick her paws up there. For 100+ dollars this really isn't worth all the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey

customer_reviews.title: A great automatic feeder
customer_reviews.text: We have only had this feeder for a couple of months so far but it is working great. I really like the customization for the portion settings. I really like how much food it stores. I believe it is perfect for a cat. I don't think I could recommend it for a medium sized or larger dog because I think a strong/playful dog would be able to break into the device. My only gripe is the control panel, it's a little cumbersome to navigate but once you figure it out it's okay. We used to have a rotating pie type feeder but this is much better. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a must-have for the feeder
customer_reviews.text: I thought I could get by just with rechargeable batteries for my feeder, but they quickly ran out of batteries after a month and the schedule gets fully reset with every battery change. While it's a bit inconvenient to have to place the feeder near an outlet instead, at least this way you will not have to reschedule your feeder with every battery change - or have to figure out how to change out batteries with a full feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Really helps with the fat cats diet.
customer_reviews.text: Ms. fat cat. You are now on a diet. Congratulations. You have lost 5lbs, down from 18. Your feet still feel like pokers into my lungs when you walk on me, but don't hurt as much. You still have a couple more to go, but the drawback is, you can now jump on the furniture so you can scope out the kitchen counters. Bread items are being stored in the microwave once again.
customer_reviews.author: Dyna

customer_reviews.title: Consistent and reliable
customer_reviews.text: This was a life saver with our dog who was diagnosed with Diabetes. Since he needed to be fed at consistent times and at consistent servings this was perfect for us. We didn't have to worry about getting home exactly on time for his feedings (or getting out of bed to feed him on time). We never had any problems with it. We bought the power adapter because running off battery would have meant replacing batteries too often, though we still put in batteries so it would keep it's programming and time when our power went out.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C.

customer_reviews.title: Made our lives so much easier!
customer_reviews.text: We travel a lot and these dog feeders have made our lives so much easier! I set them to feed the dogs twice a day and it works like a charm. I have adjusted the feeding portions easily and the slow mode feed is great for my dog that eats too fast. No more hiring someone to come feed our dogs while we are gone. We even went on a 10 day trip and they worked great while we were gone!! I only have to replace the batteries about once a year.
customer_reviews.author: Daneen Parish

customer_reviews.title: Would give it 10 stars if I could!
customer_reviews.text: Our old feeder broke so after much research we ordered this feeder (with the additional electric plug). I can't say enough good things about it! Once you follow the start up instructions and get it going it is wonderful... we have it programmed to give our Labrador 3/4 cup feed 4 times a day,and it's on time, every time! Bonus, we took it in our motorhome for a weekend get away, so easy, just pick it up and take it with you! We bought the extra electrical plug cord, but the battery operation is great, when we moved it to the RV it didn't miss a lick! WE LOVE THIS!!!!
customer_reviews.author: P. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Our cat was getting fed multiple times per day by different people in the house and was getting overweight. He would also wake us up looking for food and was annoying overall. The pet feeder has been a great product! He no longer associates us with food, instead he sits at the food god waiting for his dose of pellets. He's a a good weight and seems to enjoy the reliability of being fed at the same time. Weaknesses of this product are the confusing settings menus and the clock is not keeping time very well. It seems to lose a minute every few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Berricks

customer_reviews.title: This thing is wonderful. We can feed him in two smaller feedings ...
customer_reviews.text: Our cat lives and dies by his feeding schedule. For years my husband and I would take turns waking up at 5 am to feed our food motivated kitty. Why we never thought to get an automatic feeder is beyond me. This thing is wonderful. We can feed him in two smaller feedings at each meal time, spaced 5 minutes apart, so that he doesn't inhale all his food in one swoop (and them puke it up). Now, when he's feeling like it's close to time to eat, he doesn't walk on our faces. He just goes downstairs and waits for this miracle machine to dispense those precious kibbles, and the husband and I get some sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Breia Goo

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 12 months
customer_reviews.text: This product did work well. Sometimes the portions were a little smaller than they should be; however, at almost 12 months of owning this item it has stopped working altogether and the company only warrantees the product for 45 days. For $100+ I want a product that lasts longer than a year. I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree N.

customer_reviews.title: Thought it would last longer.
customer_reviews.text: We originally bought this when our dog had parotid duct transposition surgery to correct dry eye. She needed food stimulation every so often throughout the day while we were at work to stimulate saliva production to water the eye. For the price I paid, I expected more than 2 years of use before it stopped working. We cleaned it, used the recommended food size in it. It got jammed a couple of times, cleaned it out and went on. It got jammed the last time, according to the error message, but there was no jam. Took it apart three times to make sure I hadn't missed something. We are now just feeding her once a day.
customer_reviews.author: Rayven

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but steep price w/o AC adapter
customer_reviews.text: The feeder itself is great, but I have to leave three stars because despite the steep price, THIS DOES NOT COME WITH AN AC ADAPTER. You have to buy the adapter for ~$20 separately, which is a silly price for an AC adapter. Otherwise, you need to use 4D cell batteries (not included). I tried using rechargeable batteries to save money and waster, and it ran out of juice really quickly. The battery indicator was no help, too, because it went from half charged to dead in a day. Now I'm compelled to buy the AC adapter.
customer_reviews.author: AKA

customer_reviews.title: Worked okay for a few weeks, then suddenly stopped working
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our kitten to regulate his feeding, and we liked the fact that it came with a metal bowl. It worked okay for a few weeks. Setting up the timing is difficult and not very intuitive. After a few weeks, the machine just stopped working. The LED developed black spots, and even resetting the feeding schedule did nothing. It would have the time of next feeding displayed but literally no food would be dispensed. Quite disappointing as this is not a cheap product, but we were over our 30 days and cannot return or get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: It's an AC adapter cord, it works, what else is there to say?
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work as advertised, supplies power to my Petsafe Simply Feed automatic feeder. I agree with other reviewers that the AC adapter cord should have been included with the automatic feeder and not sold separately. I mean, just the feeder was $100, did they really need to squeeze me for another 12 bucks? I will update if it stops working, but so far, so good. I'm in the testing phase to make sure the feeder will perform as programmed for number of/frequency of/ portion size of meals but in the end, this is just a cord and it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feeder works well with big dogs - and Customer Care is GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I have three big dogs and a kennel with a dog door that goes into the garage. When we go on overnight trips, the dogs get fed by PetSafe. The feeders are reliable and sturdy - We got our first one in 2016, and two more in 2018, and they still work perfectly. I accidentally dropped one off a workbench and the cover broke. I messaged PetSafe and they responded the Next Day! with a replacement. Not too often you can combine a good product with excellent service.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Great feeder, my cat loves it :)
customer_reviews.text: I got this feeder because my cat Kuzya was getting toooo fat. The package came in on the second day. It was easy to program, just read the instruction. Works like a charm. Kuzya was not happy for a couple of days, because he used to eat anytime he wanted, but now he is ok with the schedule. The funny thing is that, he knows when food will be dispensed and comes to feeder 2-3 early. I already can see him losing weight. If you want automatic feeder buy this one, it really works.
customer_reviews.author: Maksym Mysak

customer_reviews.title: An Indespensible Dispenser
customer_reviews.text: This was really simple to set up. I got two since my cats hat each other and have to eat in separate rooms. It took less than ten minutes to program both units and they work perfectly. It took about a week for my cats to not freak out when the food was dispensed. The very best part is I no longer have two cats shoving their little meowlers under my bedroom door at 5am begging for their 6am meal. Now they just wait by the dispensers for the food to fall. It’s also nice not having to arrange for someone to come over twice a day to feed them when we’re out of town.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: We use the small Blue Buffalo cat food and while it seems to dispense a bit more than it says, it’s easy enough to adjust. So far we’ve been really pleased with the purchase and for some reason our cat is eating less (even though he’s served more than before) and he’s not hounding is for food like he used to. He no longer looks at us like we’re a means to food which is a nice bonus because he used to be a total better. I think he’s dropped a couple ounces and he’s looking quite handsome and svelte. YMMV
customer_reviews.author: co2h2o

customer_reviews.title: Durable, well-made auto feeder
customer_reviews.text: This feeder is very durable and always works. I bought this feeder to feed my outdoor cats at particular times of the day, so the raccoons could not eat all of their food. I placed it out of reach of three raccoons, but sometimes they figure out how to get to it. They've knocked it over, but they're never able to get inside to the food. I couldn't ask for a better product. I should add that I've had this feeder for over a year now. I only use Friskies dry catfood, and I have it plugged into the wall with battery backup. The feeder is set for 2x per day, and I have used multiple measurement settings.
customer_reviews.author: Kandi Rodrigue

customer_reviews.title: Nice product.
customer_reviews.text: Quality product, easy to use and set up and works as advertised. I suggest using inside only as the raccoons tore it to shreds. Very nice feeder for inside cats.
customer_reviews.author: Della

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about this product. It was working out great, I even bought a splitter piece that way it can feed two cats at once. One day it decided to just top working when we were out of town. I tried replacing the batteries and we just could not get the food to drop currently. We ended up having to do away with it because I couldn't rely on it to feed my cats.
customer_reviews.author: christy canaday

customer_reviews.title: Had it for over a year now, works great!
customer_reviews.text: My cat hasn't been able to figure out how to get into this one! Very customizable, yes you have to sit down and really read the directions, step by step. It's not very intuitive to set up but it's not as hard as some reviews claim. I like that it can take batteries and/or use the plug. I also like it has a stainless steel bowl, not plastic. I've had 3 automatic feeders over the years and this has been the best one so far.
customer_reviews.author: Davina Camardo

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with a power cord or batteries
customer_reviews.text: My feeders have been working fine for the last couple of months. Two frustrations: 1. For the price that is charged, it would be nice if the feeder came with a power cord instead of selling that separately. 2. I wish there was a setting for 1/3 cup of food. 1/8 c is the minimum and then it jumps up to 1/4 c. If you order these before a trip, make sure you get them a day or two ahead of your departure. It takes time to figure out how to set it up then ensure they are working. I definitely had to tweak mine a couple of times before they were properly delivering food.
customer_reviews.author: mechem03

product_meta.title: PetSafe Healthy Pet Simply Feed Automatic Dog and Cat Feeder, Pet Food Dispenser, Simply Feed Power Adaptor Accessory, 2 Meal Splitter Accessory
product_meta.description: Style:Healthy Pet Simply FeedSay goodnight to your early morning wake-up call. With the PetSafe® Healthy Pet Simply Feed schedule your pet’s meals, so they are fed on time, every day of the week (including sleep-in weekends). The Healthy Pet Simply Feed holds 24 cups of dry or semi-moist food and dispenses it y using a unique, conveyor system. You can schedule up to 12 meals daily from 1/8 cup up to 4 cups per meal depending on your dog or cat’s needs. The feeder portions the meals for you so you can easily manage your pet’s weight to keep them healthy. The Slow Feed feature is great for pets that are fast eaters. With this feature, the feeder will slowly dispense meals larger than 1/8 cup over 15 minutes. Simply press the Feed Now button on the feeder, to dispense a meal earlier than scheduled. The Healthy Pet Simply Feed has a pet-proof design to keep prying paws from sneaking food. The feeder is easy to dissemble when it is ready to be cleaned - simply place the feeder and stainless-steel bowl in the top-rack of your dishwasher and hand wash the conveyor system. PetSafe brand is here to help you and your pet live happy together.
feature_bullets: SCHEDULE YOUR PET'S MEALS: Conveniently schedule up to 12 meals per day for your cat or dog; best for cats and small to medium sized dogs
FLEXIBLE PORTIONS: Schedule 1/8 cup to 4 cups per meal depending on your pet’s unique needs; requires 4 D-cell alkaline batteries (not included) or power adaptor (adaptor sold separately)
WORKS WITH MOST KIBBLE: Feeder works with dry and semi-moist pet kibble that is up to 3/4 inch in diameter
SLOW FEED OPTIONS: For pets who tend to eat too quickly, schedule meals larger than 1/8 cup to slowly dispense over 15 minutes
PET-PROOF: The feeder is designed to keep prying paws from sneaking food before scheduled mealtimes
EASY TO CLEAN: Place the BPA-free plastic feeder parts and stainless-steel bowl in the top-rack of the dishwasher for easy cleaning; hand wash the conveyor system separately
U.S.-BASED CUSTOMER CARE: Let our pet product experts help; we’re available Monday through Saturday to answer your questions at 1-800-845-3274
QUALITY GUARANTEED: PetSafe brand has been a trusted global leader in pet behavior, containment and lifestyle innovations for nearly 30 years; we help pets and their people live happy together

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
